file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 30-80-01-04 - ICE DETECTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ICE DETECTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the ice detectors. B. These procedures are applicable to the 1 and 2 ice detectors. C. The ice detector 1 is installed on the skin of the forward fuselage, on the LH side of the cockpit. D. The ice detector 2 is installed on the skin of the forward fuselage, on the RH side of the cockpit. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 30-80-01-000-801-A ICE DETECTOR - REMOVAL ALL 30-80-01-400-801-A ICE DETECTOR - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 30-80-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-80-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ICE DETECTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the ice detector. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE RH or LH forward fuselage skin (cockpit 1 Does the task zone) I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them: • ICE DETECTOR 1, on the LH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). • ICE DETECTOR 2, on the RH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). • ICE DETECTOR 1 and ICE DETECTOR 2, on the overhead Circuit Breaker Panel. DET 1: (Location tip: DC BUS 1/ICE AND RAIN PROTECTION/DET 1). DET 2: (Location tip: DC BUS 2/ICE AND RAIN PROTECTION/DET 2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-80-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the four screws (4) and remove the cover (3). (2) Remove the five screws (5) and pull the ice detector (2). (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (4) Remove the ice detector (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-80-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Ice Detector - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A A ZONE ZONE 224 223 DET. A ICE DETECTOR 2 ICE DETECTOR 1 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 2. ICE DETECTOR 3. COVER DET. A SEALANT 5. SCREW (5) 4. SCREW (4) 145AMM300014.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-80-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-80-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ICE DETECTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the ice detector. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 AMM TASK 30-80-00-700-801-A/500 ICE DETECTION SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MOLYKOTE DC-33 LIGHT Silicone grease AR MIL-S-8802, Type II, Class B2 Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE RH or LH forward fuselage skin (cockpit 1 Does the task zone) I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Connect the electrical connector (1) to the ice detector (2). (2) Put the ice detector (2) in its installation position on the skin and install the five screws (5). (3) Apply a thin coat of grease along the contour of the center opening of the cover (3). (4) Position the cover (3) on the ice detector (2) and install the four screws (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-80-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags from them: • ICE DETECTOR 1 and ICE DETECTOR 2, on the overhead Circuit Breaker Panel. DET 1: (Location tip: DC BUS 1/ICE AND RAIN PROTECTION/DET 1). DET 2: (Location tip: DC BUS 2/ICE AND RAIN PROTECTION/DET 2). • ICE DETECTOR 1, on the LH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). • ICE DETECTOR 2, on the RH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). (2) Do an operational test of the ice detection system ( AMM TASK 30-80-00-700-801-A/ 500). (3) Apply sealant to the interface between the contour of the center opening of the cover (3) and the ice detector (2), as necessary (SRM 51-20-01). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-80-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
